activities: The CDM Group process personal data about its employees (including current, former or prospective employees, temporary workers, interns and other non-permanent employees of subsidiaries and affiliates of The CDM Group who are located in France, Germany, Spain and the UK)(collectively, “Employees”) when carrying out and supporting HR functions and activities, including: (1) recruiting and hiring job applicants; (2) managing Employee communications and relations; (3) providing compensation and benefits; (4) administering payroll; (5) processing corporate expenses and reimbursements; (6) managing Employee participation in human resources plans and programs; (7) carrying out obligations under employment contracts; (8) managing Employee performance; (9) conducting training and talent development; (10) facilitating Employee relocations and international assignments; (11) managing Employee headcount and office allocation; (12) managing the Employee termination process; (13) managing information technology and communications systems, such as the corporate email system and company directory; (14) conducting ethics and disciplinary investigations; (15) administering Employee grievances and claims; (16) managing audit and compliance matters; (17) complying with applicable legal obligations, including government reporting and specific local law requirements; and (18) for other general human resources purposes. The CDM Group also may obtain and process personal data about Employees’ emergency contacts and other individuals (such as spouse, family members, dependents and beneficiaries) to the extent Employees provide such information to The CDM Group. The CDM Group processes this information to comply with its legal obligations and for benefits administration and other internal administrative purposes.
